title: External Hard Drive from Hard Disk
description: This is just a simple sunday project I did on my freshman year after I dissect my old laptop. This shows a simple way to make an external hard drive out of laptop's hard disk.

steps.title: Step 1
steps.text: First of all, after I took out the hard disk i check the port in which the hard disk is using. from the picture you can see that the harddisk port looks like a 'T' shape, which have a small port on the left, and a big one on the right.

steps.title: Step 2
steps.text: I actually bought a case that comes with the port circuit. Make sure that the port is compatible with the internal hard disk.

steps.title: Step 3
steps.text: The above look of the circuit.

steps.title: Step 4
steps.text: Plug it carefully to the hard disk and make sure that it fits correctly.

steps.title: Step 5
steps.text: The bottom view of the plugged hard disk.

steps.title: Step 6
steps.text: Now all you have to do is to put it in the casing and screw it.

steps.title: Step 7
steps.text: The finished product! plug it to your computer and test it on!
